availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Taylor (Madison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Married Mahala Ferrel Taylor in Mercer County, Kentucky, on November 20, 1857. Father of James F. Taylor, Jane C. Taylor, Mary R. Taylor, and Archie P. Taylor. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Madison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 211A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision, p. 165.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision, p. 458B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Cornishville, p. 468A-B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191863.
